name: Michael Howell From Capital Wars
title: Us Fed Qe Needs To Restart Fast
text:
Synopsis
US money market liquidity is showing signs of tightening, suggesting potential need for Federal Reserve to restart Quantitative Easing (QE) to prevent further financial stress.

Key Insights
- Cash assets of smaller US banks are declining, approaching levels seen during the March 2023 Silicon Valley Bank (SVB) crisis
- SOFR rates are increasingly trading close to or above Fed Funds rates, indicating market stress
- Banks' reserves are hovering at or below the estimated minimum operating level of US$3.2 trillion
- The current liquidity conditions suggest potential risk of financial system instability
